pageContext.description:
Portrait of the saxon Elector Friedrich III (1463-1525) as a half-length figure against a blue background.
[cda 2019]
This is one of a number of portraits painted by Cranach of his most important early patron. The earliest dated example of this particular type is that of 1522 formerly in Gotha, Schlossmuseum, [PRIVATE_NONE-P223], which shows the Elector before his beard turned grey. The present work dates from 1525, the year of the Elector's death, or shortly thereafter. It is one of approximately ten posthumous autograph portraits of the Elector from this period. Another such, signed and dated 1525, is [PRIVATE_NONE-P240]. The demand for repetitions of this particular portrait type persisted well into the 1530s when they were often combined with portraits of Johann Frederick the Magnanimous and Johann the Steadfast. These images were often accompanied by laudatory verses glued to the panels as here.
[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2006/old-master-paintings-l06030/lot.22.html?locale=en; accessed 21-03-2019]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 37.2 x 24 cm
[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2006/old-master-paintings-l06030/lot.22.html?locale=en; access 12-03-2019]
pageContext.inscription: 'Friderico Tertio Magno . pio. Duoi. [sic] Saxonie. Fridrich bin ich billich genand // Schonen fried ich erhielt yn Land // Durch gros vernunft geduld vnd glück // Widder machenn ertzbosenn tück // Das land ich zieret mit gebew // vnd stifft ein hohe Schull auffs new // Zu Wittenberg im Sachsen Land // In aller welt die ward bekannd Denn aus der selb kam Gottis wortt // vnd thet gros ding an manchem ort // des bepstlich reich stortzt es nidder // vnd bracht rechten glauben widder // Zum Kaiser war erkornen ich // Des mein alter beschweret sich // darfür ich Kaiser Carl erwelt // Davon mich nicht wand gonst noch // gelt.' [cda 2019]'
pageContext.medium:
Painting on wood
[Sotheby's online database; http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2006/old-master-paintings-l06030/lot.22.html?locale=en; access 12-03-2019]
